attributes.action: Mandatory viewing of David Attenborough's A Life On Our Planet for all MPs in UK
attributes.additional_details: Because our future is at risk, this is an urgent issue. We want the government to care more about the environment and it's people. We want them to take action and make incentives like countries such as Costa Rica... We want them to educate themselves and care about the world we live in and the people they are creating laws for. We want them to use their power on a larger scale because we can't.
attributes.background: We demand that everyone in governmental power, from all parties, watches this documentary and acts proactively towards Climate Change. We need to create systemic changes to our world, on a practical long lasting level.

rejection.details:
The Government is not responsible for the viewing activity of individual MPs. This is a matter for each MP to decide for themselves.

We have published the following related petition, which you might like to sign:

Reform food, energy, environmental and fishing policy to save the planet: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/554376
